column4: Can someone please help me with getting sound to work for flash?
Can someone please help me getting flash to work on my x64 installation? I have no sound when a video plays.
Can someone please help me fix my no-sound issue with x64 Adobe Flash?
truthfully Rob, uninstall flash from Ubuntu and download and use Adobe's flash ofr 64bit
Done.
Darthanubis: I've tried installing flash every way possible, I did a clean install of 9.10 and installed the Alpha version of flash from Adobe's website. Still nothing.
extract the plugin to ~./mozilla/plugins
Darthanubis: I already did.
Darthanubis: Flash works, there's just no sound.
Darthanubis: I think it has to do with my unconventional audio-card uninstallation.
make SURe no other flash/gnash packages from Ubuntu is installed on your system
Darthanubis: I did a clean install, I'm 100% sure there isn't one.
Darthanubus, But to get my audio card to work, I had to install ALSA 1.0.21, and then...because my audio card has multiple outputs, I had to install Kmix to select the correct one.
use gnome-alsamixer to adjust sound
Darthanubus, sound works, though...just not with flash.
let me see if that works. One moment.
I had tha before. Close Firefox, killall -9 pulseaudio, restart pulseaudio via alt-f2 then reopen youtube
still doesn't work.
When I open gnome-alsamixer...nothing happens?
'nothing" that can't be good
How do I uninstall flash if I installed it from the official adobe site?
how do I uninstall my current installation of flash?
